theme_duke()

Aidan Gildea

2023-02-08

Source: vignettes/theme_duke_vignette.Rmd
theme_duke_vignette.Rmd

This vignette is intended to demonstrate the breadth of theme_duke() and its various applications. Similar to the other functions within the theme(), this function can be applied to all ggplot2 visualizations.

Plot Examples

For these visualizations, we will use the R dummy data set palmerpenguins.

#install.packages("palmerpenguins")
library(palmerpenguins)
library(duke)
library(ggplot2)
attach(penguins)

Using theme_duke() on scatter plots 

plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(bill_length_mm, flipper_length_mm)) +
  ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(colour = species)) +
  ggplot2::labs(title = "Bill Length vs. Flipper Length", caption = "There are three different species of penguins.", x = "Bill Length (mm)", y = "Flipper Length (mm)")

plot + 
  theme_duke()
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Garamond 3 LT Std is not available on
#> your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (`geom_point()`).

Using theme_duke() on bar plots 

plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(species)) +
  ggplot2::geom_bar(ggplot2::aes(fill = species)) +
  ggplot2::labs(title = "Species Count", caption = "There are three different species of penguins.", x = "Species", y = "Count")

plot + theme_duke()
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Garamond 3 LT Std is not available on
#> your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

Using theme_duke() on histograms 

## if one variable, do we want fill to be duke blue
## have scale_color that would give custom colors to different dists.
plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(body_mass_g)) +
  ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(fill = species)) +
  ggplot2::labs(title = "Distribution of Penguin Body Mass", caption = "There are three different species of penguins.", x = "Body Mass (g)", y = "Count")

plot + theme_duke()
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Garamond 3 LT Std is not available on
#> your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.
#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_bin()`).

Using theme_duke() on box plots 

plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(sex, body_mass_g)) +
  ggplot2::geom_boxplot() +
  ggplot2::labs(title = "Comparison of Body Mass By Sex", x = "Sex", y = "Body Mass (g)")

plot + theme_duke()
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Garamond 3 LT Std is not available on
#> your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_boxplot()`).

Using theme_duke() on density plots 

plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(bill_depth_mm)) +
  ggplot2::geom_density() +
  ggplot2::labs(title = "Density of Penguin Bill Depth", x = "Bill Depth (mm)", y = "Densiy")

plot + theme_duke()
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Garamond 3 LT Std is not available on
#> your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.
#> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite values (`stat_density()`).

Using theme_duke() on jitter plot 

plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(palmerpenguins::penguins, ggplot2::aes(year, body_mass_g)) +
  ggplot2::geom_jitter() +
  ggplot2::labs(title = "Comparison of Body Mass By Year", x = "Year", y = "Body Mass (g)")

plot + theme_duke()
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Garamond 3 LT Std is not available on
#> your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.
#> Warning in value[[3L]](cond): Atkinson-Hyperlegible is not available on your system. Please download and install for custom font functionality.

#> Warning in theme_duke(): Defaulting to sans font.
